csc_matrix_t Struct Reference

#include <csc_matrix.h>


Data Fields

Detailed Description

Author:
Mark Hoemmen
Since:
06/08/04 11:11:48 PDT
Sparse matrix in Compressed Sparse Column (also known as Harwell-Boeing) format.

Field Documentation

int* csc_matrix_t::colptr

Array of indices into the rowidx and values arrays, for each column

void(* csc_matrix_t::deallocator)(void *)

The deallocation function to be called on the values, colidx and rowptr arrays, if ownership == LIBRARY_DEALLOCATES.

int csc_matrix_t::m

Number of rows in the matrix

int csc_matrix_t::n

Number of columns in the matrix

int csc_matrix_t::nnz

Number of stored (nonzero) entries. If the matrix is stored in a symmetric (or skew, etc.) format, nnz only refers to the number of stored entries, not the actual number of nonzeros.

enum ownership_mode_t csc_matrix_t::ownership

The ownership mode: tells whether this library or the user is responsible for deallocating input arrays.

int* csc_matrix_t::rowidx

Array of row indices of the stored (nonzero) entries of the matrix

enum symmetric_storage_location_t csc_matrix_t::symmetric_storage_location

If the matrix has a kind of symmetry (or skew-symmetry): Where the actual elements of the matrix are stored: in the lower triangle or the upper triangle.

enum symmetry_type_t csc_matrix_t::symmetry_type

Symmetry type of the matrix.

enum value_type_t csc_matrix_t::value_type

Indicates the type of the entries in val: REAL means "double", COMPLEX means "double _Complex", PATTERN means the "val" array is NULL and contains no entries.

void* csc_matrix_t::values

Array of stored (nonzero) entries of the matrix
